  • Uses of IAction in com.actions

    Classes in com.actions that implement IAction
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    class 
    Attack
    A character attacks another character using the item in their right hand.
    class 
    Bash
    A character bashes the specified furniture with their right hand.
    class 
    Cast
    Character casts a spell.
    class 
    Clap
    A character claps for a few seconds where they are standing or sitting.
    class 
    CloseFurniture
    Character walks to a furniture and closes it.
    class 
    Create<T extends ICreate<?>>
    Use This action to create a place or item.
    class 
    CreateEffect
    Creates a temporary effect on an entity which disappears after a few seconds.
    class 
    Dance
    The character dances.
    class 
    Die
    A character dies where they're standing.
    class 
    DisableEffect
    Hides an effect that was previously enabled on a character, item, or furniture.
    class 
    DisableInput
    Disables mouse and keyboard controls.
    class 
    Draw
    Character draws an item and holds it with their right hand.
    class 
    Drink
    Character drinks from the items they're holding in their left hand.
    class 
    EnableEffect
    Creates an effect on an entity which remains until disabled.
    class 
    EnableInput
    Enables mouse and keybord input for the character that is set to the focus of the camera by SetCameraFocus.
    class 
    Enter
    Character enters from a door.
    class 
    Exit
    Character walks to, opens, and exits through a door.
    class 
    Face
    Character turns to face another character, item, or furniture within the same place.
    class 
    FadeIn
    The screen fades in from black.
    class 
    FadeOut
    The screen fades out to black.
    class 
    Give
    Character walks to and hands an item to another character with their left hand.
    class 
    HideCredits
    Closes the credits window.
    class 
    HideDialog
    Closes the dialog window.
    class 
    HideFurniture
    Hides a piece of furniture.
    class 
    HideList
    Closes the list window.
    class 
    HideMenu
    To start Camelot for the player, you must first use ShowMenu.
    class 
    HideNarration
    Closes the narration window.
    class 
    Kneel
    A character kneels down where they are standing.
    class 
    Laugh
    A character laughs where they are standing or sitting.
    class 
    LookAt
    A character will turn their head to keep looking at another character, item, or furniture.
    class 
    OpenFurniture
    A character walks to a piece of furniture and opens it.
    class 
    Pickup
    A character bends down to pick up an item from the ground.
    class 
    PlaySound
    Plays a short sound effect or background music.
    class 
    Pocket
    A character puts the item they're holding in their left hand in their pocket.
    class 
    Put
    Character extends their arm to put an item they're holding in their left hand.
    class 
    Putdown
    A character bends down to put down an item on the ground.
    class 
    Revive
    A dead character comes back to life and stands up.
    class 
    SetCameraBlend
    Sets the duration of camera transitions when using SetCameraMode and SetCameraFocus.
    class 
    SetCameraFocus
    Set the focus of the main camera to an entity.
    class 
    SetCameraMode
    Set camera mode to track, follow, or focus.
    class 
    SetClothing
    Changes the outfit of a character.
    class 
    SetDay
    Sets the time of the day to daytime.
    class 
    SetExpression
    Changes the expression and gesture of a character.
    class 
    SetHairColor
    Changes the hair color of a character.
    class 
    SetHairStyle
    Changes the hair style of a character.
    class 
    SetNight
    Changes the time of day to night time.
    class 
    SetPosition
    Create an instance of this class whenever you want to change the position of a character or item.
    class 
    SetTitle
    Sets the title of the story shown on the main menu.
    class 
    Sheathe
    Character sheathes the item they're holding in their right hand.
    class 
    ShowFurniture
    Makes a previously hidden furniture to appear again.
    class 
    ShowMenu
    To start Camelot for the player, you must first use ShowMenu.
    class 
    Sit
    A character sits down on a piece of furniture.
    class 
    Sleep
    A character lies down on a piece of furniture.
    class 
    Take
    The specified character walks to an item and takes it.
    class 
    Unpocket
    A character takes something out of their pocket and holds them in their left hand.
    class 
    Wait
    The action succeeds after the specified number of seconds.
    class 
    WalkTo
    Character walks to a target position.
    class 
    Wave
    A character waves their hand in the air where they are standing or sitting.
